content: *single_crochet in the first two sts fpdc in the next st - placed three row below* repeat until you have 2 sts left place a single_crochet in each tc 44 row 5 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 44 repeat row 2 to row 5 for a total of 9 sets of squares made-to-measure tip make sure the panel is long enough to fit your book body borders & sewing the edges 4 5 mm any colour now simply fold the fabric facing the right side rs and slip_stitch together the sides - take care of hiding the strands created by the colour change sew the sides together if you prefer fold along the white line the centre of the fabric and facing the rs check if the two long sides red lines and the two bottom sides the two half of the short side in blue are aligned start slip_stitch all around the red line and 4 blue line to seam together these edges - making sure to hide the strands created by the colour change start in the top corner slip_stitch stitching around to reach the bottom after stitching the red sides together move to the bottom blue side at the end you will have only the top side opened this creates the book sleeve you can stop here for an easier make flap 4 5 mm decide which side is the front side that is where you are going to attach the button in colour b facing the rs attach the yarn at the top right side of the back of the sleeve row 1 place 26 single_crochet sts along this top border tc 26 made-to-measure tip if you have made more or less squares for your version simply place single_crochet sts all along half of the opening a multiple of 3 - 1 number of stitches row 2 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 26 in colour a row 3 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 26 row 4 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 26 after 4 row it looks like in the figure here 5 in colour b row 5 *single_crochet in the first two sts fpdc in the next st- placed three row below* repeat until you have 2 sts left place a single_crochet in each tc 26 row 6 single_crochet until the end of the row tc 26 repeat row 3 to row 6 for a total of 3 sets of squares for the flap fasten_off note you can add extra sets of squares if you want a longer flap flap borders 4 5 mm any colour for a tidier look attach the yarn at the bottom right corner of the flap facing the right side and single_crochet around in colour b to hide the strands buttonhole & button 4 5 mm any colour folding the flap sew the button where the flap touches the body of the book sleeve facing the wrong side
